In computer science, a \call stack** is a stack data structure that stores information about the active subroutines of a computer programâ€¦ the main reason for having call stack is \to keep track of the point** to which each active subroutine should return control when it finishes executingâ€¦ A \call stack** is composed of \stack frames**â€¦ Each stack frame corresponds to a call to a subroutine which has not yet terminated with a \return**. For example, if a subroutine named DrawLine is currently running, having been called by a subroutine DrawSquare, the top part of the call stack might be laid out like in the adjacent picture.
